Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, like a playground, garden, or forest, showing different types of plants and animals found there.
The student can draw a water habitat, like a pond, stream, or lake, showing different types of plants and animals found there.
The student can include in the drawings a variety of living things such as trees, flowers, animals, and bugs appropriate to each habitat.
The student can use their drawings to show how habitats on land and in water have different sets of plants and animals.
The student can organize their drawings to compare and show the diversity of life between the different habitats.
